definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) Operation; action.
Method of operation.
The incidental or subsidiary calculations performed in solving an overall problem.
definitions.example: Be sure to check your working.

definitions.definition: Fermentation.
(of bodies of water) Becoming full of a vegetable substance.
A place where work is carried on.
definitions.example: the abandoned mine workings

definitions.definition: To do a specific task by employing physical or mental powers.
definitions.example: He’s working in a bar.

definitions.definition: To effect by gradual degrees.
definitions.example: he worked his way through the crowd

definitions.definition: To embroider with thread.
To set into action.
definitions.example: He worked the levers.

definitions.definition: To cause to ferment.
To ferment.
To exhaust, by working.
definitions.example: The mine was worked until the last scrap of ore had been extracted.

definitions.definition: To shape, form, or improve a material.
definitions.example: He used pliers to work the wire into shape.

definitions.definition: To operate in a certain place, area, or speciality.
definitions.example: she works the night clubs

definitions.definition: To operate in or through; as, to work the phones.
To provoke or excite; to influence.
definitions.example: The rock musician worked the crowd of young girls into a frenzy.

definitions.definition: To use or manipulate to one’s advantage.
definitions.example: She knows how to work the system.

definitions.definition: To cause to happen or to occur as a consequence.
definitions.example: I cannot work a miracle.

definitions.definition: To cause to work.
definitions.example: He is working his servants hard.

definitions.definition: To function correctly; to act as intended; to achieve the goal designed for.
definitions.example: he pointed at the car and asked, "Does it work"?;  he looked at the bottle of pain pills, wondering if they would work;  my plan didn’t work

definitions.definition: To influence.
definitions.example: They worked on her to join the group.

definitions.definition: To effect by gradual degrees; as, to work into the earth.
To move in an agitated manner.
definitions.example: A ship works in a heavy sea.

definitions.definition: To behave in a certain way when handled
definitions.example: this dough does not work easily;  the soft metal works well

definitions.definition: (with two objects) To cause (someone) to feel (something); to do unto somebody (something, whether good or bad).
To hurt; to ache.
That is or are functioning.
definitions.example: a working ventilator

definitions.definition: That suffices but requires additional work.
definitions.example: a working copy of the script

definitions.definition: In paid employment.
definitions.example: working mothers

definitions.definition: Of or relating to employment.
definitions.example: the working week

definitions.definition: Enough to allow one to use something.
definitions.example: a working knowledge of computers

definitions.definition: Used in real life; practical.
definitions.example: The working minimum focus distance is the distance from the closest focusable subject to the lens.
